text: Hey <@U01AA7U2ECA> and <@U01ABLH7DPY>! I was looking over the grad and postdoc directory today, to get some ideas for potential presenters. I noticed that Liz Morin-Lessard appears to be quite active on OSF, with a few studies sharing stimuli, data, etc. She might be a good option for a presenter in the Project Workflow session, as it seems she has some experience with planning projects to include a open science component. Here is the link to her OSF profile: <https://osf.io/vmiwg/>

attachments.title: OSF | Elizabeth Morin-Lessard
attachments.text: Hosted on the Open Science Framework

I noticed that Liz Morin-Lessard appears to be quite active on OSF, with a few studies sharing stimuli, data, etc. She might be a good option for a presenter in the Project Workflow session, as it seems she has some experience with planning projects to include a open science component. Here is the link to her OSF profile:

text:
Hi <!channel> Here are my notes from the meeting. Sorry if they are a bit scattered! Please add in or correct anything I have missed.

*Session schedule and presenters*

October 23 - Project workflow. Emiko to invite Liz. Will approach Michael and Kelsey if Liz is not available.

November 6 - Data sharing/Ethics. Chelsea & Elaine Atay co-present. Chelsea will invite Elaine.
 
November 20 - Pre-registration. Emiko will invite Brittany, provide info about her preregistration process to Brittany.

December 4 - Troubleshooting open science. Chelsea to reach out to her contact in Kinesiology about presenting. Propose dividing breakout discussions by research field for this session.

*Info/Actions for Friday’s meeting*

Add 5-minute break between presentation and round 2 to agenda - Emiko
 
Track registration and randomize attendees to breakout rooms each round - Chelsea
 
Send reminder email to attendees and email to facilitators with guide - Emiko, to send Thursday
 
Create poll for end of meeting to see which next actions attendees are interested in - Emiko

Emiko will be the contact for people interested in presenting.

text: I could actually co-present with Brittany - it turns out my poster presentation on that day is 4 - 6 Eastern time, so I’ll be available 4 - 6pm Mountain Time. Should I suggest to Brittany that we co-present that session?
